comments.name: MATERIAL
comments.text:
As far as visible during the inspection areas of the structure include:
Typical wood framing

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the exterior walls:
Cracks noted.  Some cracking is to be expected in all exterior surfaces as the property settles with age. Recommend monitoring for any future changes.
Recommend caulking/sealing all wall penetrations and any intersections between building materials

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Slab is not fully visible.
The following concerns were noted at the slab:
Typical cracks in slab noted.  Some cracking is to be expected as the property settles with age.Recommend monitoring for any future changes.
Typical corner cracking noted.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the driveway:
Cracks noted.  Some cracking is to be expected as the property settles with age. Recommend monitoring for any future changes.
Surface raised/settled, Repair as needed.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the landscaping:
Trim plants away from structure regularly to help prevent damage and pest intrusion.
Large tree(s) located on the property.  They may present problems (now or in the future) with site drainage, roof/structure damage, plumbing, and/or foundation conditions. Recommend monitoring the situation for problems and consult with an expert as needed.
Trees are touching/overhanging the roof.  Damage is possible. Trim plants and trees away from structure regularly to help prevent damage and pest intrusion.

comments.name: SITE
comments.text:
Grade at foundation appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted with grading:
Lower soil below siding.  Grade should be 6 inches below any wood materials

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the porch:
Cracks noted.  Some cracking is to be expected as the property settles with age. Recommend monitoring for any future changes.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the patio:
Cracks noted.  Some cracking is to be expected as the property settles with age. Recommend monitoring for any future changes.

comments.name: TYPE
comments.text:
Front Porch and Rear Patio:
Same as structure, open design

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Normal signs of weathering and aging noted. Regular maintenance recommended. 
The following concerns were noted at the fence:
Previous repairs noted. Verify reason with seller and monitor for on-going or future problems.
Moisture damage noted, recommend repair as needed. 
Gate(s) require repairs or adjustment to function properly.

comments.name: ROOF COVERING STATUS
comments.text:
General condition appears serviceable with signs of weathering and aging. Regular maintenance and inspections are advised. Maintenance will help ensure the weather tightness of the building and should be performed on a regular basis.
The following concerns were noted at the roof:
Granule loss and cupping of shingles noted. These are usually the result of weathering and aging of roof covering. Repair as needed.
Deflection noted at the roof decking in several areas. Repair as needed.
Organic growth noted on the shingles. Recommend soft washing.
Nails/Fasteners are sticking through the shingles. Recommend evaluation by a qualified licensed roofer and repair/replace.
Non-professional repairs noted
Damaged shingles noted at the left side and rear right edge of roof. Recommend evaluation by a qualified licensed roofer and repair/replace.
Roof appears to be near the end of its life. Recommend evaluation by a qualified licensed roofer and repair/replace.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the flashings:
Rusty flashing is noted. Replace as needed.
Lifted flashing noted on rear right side stationary vent, recommend securing to roof surface.

comments.name: TYPE & CONDITION
comments.text: None.  Consider installing gutters and downspouts to help with site drainage

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
Rain cap noted
The following concerns were noted at the chimney:
Unable to see spark arrester. Repair as needed.

comments.name: MATERIAL AND SIZE
comments.text:
Main line is 3/4 inch diameter 
Copper

comments.name: LOCATION
comments.text: Main water shut off valve is located at the right side of the building

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text: Appears serviceable, valve not tested, water pressure appears adequate.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
Plumbing vents appear serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the waste lines:
Some piping appears to be an older type system. We recommend having a video pipe inspection performed to determine the condition of the piping. Recommend evaluation by a qualified licensed plumber and repair as needed.
ABS to PVC contact noted. Glue may not properly adhere and openings may result, monitor for problems.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
Pressure relief valve noted not tested
A water shutoff valve is installed
The following concerns were noted at the water heater:
Thermal blanket installed - unable to fully view tank

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the incoming service:
Too close to roof (should be at least 18 over roof), recommend repair.

comments.name: MAIN PANEL CONDITION
comments.text:
Circuit and wire sizing correct so far as visible
Grounding system is present

comments.name: BRANCH WIRING CIRCUIT CONDUCTORS
comments.text:
Type of conductor noted:
Non-Metallic cable with Metal/Plastic conduit

comments.name: BRANCH WIRING CIRCUIT CONDITIONS
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the branch wiring circuits:
Open junction boxes are noted- Covers are needed in the following area(s):
attic

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text: Accessible switches and receptacles were tested.  As a whole receptacles and switches throughout the building are in serviceable condition.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text: Accessible lights were tested.  As a whole lighting throughout the building is in serviceable condition.

Sink appears serviceable

Damage noted at tub, repair as needed.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text: Same as building, see building roof report

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted with the slab/floor:
Cracks noted.  Some cracking is to be expected as the property settles with age. Recommend monitoring for any future changes.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text: No fire wall provided.  Recommend adding a fire separation wall.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
Automatic door opener(s)- operational
Electric eye automatic reverse feature is operational
Pressure sensitive safety reverse feature was not tested as part of this inspection due to the risk of damage to the garage door in the event of an inoperable/not installed pressure sensitive device.
The following concerns were noted with the vehicle door:
Automatic reverse sensors are installed too high. Recommend installing it no more than 6 inches off the ground.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appear serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the walls/ceiling:
Separating tape/seams on the ceiling. Recommend repairing.
Moisture stains/damage noted above garage door, recommend repair.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text: Accessible windows were inspected.  Windows as a grouping are generally operational and appear serviceable but signs of wear and aging noted. Monitor for problems.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
General condition appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the interior walls:
Typical cracks noted.  Some cracking is to be expected in all interior surfaces as the property settles with age. Recommend monitoring for any future changes.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
General condition appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the ceilings:
Typical cracks noted.  Some cracking is to be expected in all interior surfaces as the property settles with age. Recommend monitoring for any future changes.
Moisture stains/damage noted in front left bedroom closet and formal dining area, recommend repair.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
General condition appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted with the floors:
Carpet is wrinkled. Recommend stretching.
Chipped/cracked tiles noted, repair as needed. 
Minor damage noted in formal dining room, repair as needed.

comments.name: LOCATION - TYPE - CONDITION
comments.text:
Location: Living room
Type: Prefabricated metal
Fuel source: Wood burning
Fireplace appears serviceable.
The following concerns were noted at the fireplace:
Damper is not operational, recommend repair.

comments.name: ACCESSIBILITY
comments.text: Attic is mostly accessible/was entered for inspection. However due to the inherent design of attic spaces some areas are not conducive to inspection.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the attic:
Staining noted at the roof decking and framing in several areas. Verify status and repairs with seller. Leaks not active at the time of the inspection. Repair as needed. 
Damaged decking noted at front left side of attic, recommend repair. 
Possible Microbial growth has been observed during the inspection.  No mold sampling has been performed, this information is being provided as a courtesy for our client.  Further evaluation by a qualified licensed contractor is recommended prior to closing.

comments.name: VENTILATION
comments.text: Attic ventilation is provided by Soffit vents, Gable end vents, and Stationary vents

comments.name: INSULATION CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the attic insulation:
Some insulation has been moved/disturbed.  Recommend replacing insulation to previous condition.
Add additional insulation as needed.

comments.name: VAPOR BARRIER CONDITION
comments.text: Vapor barrier was not visible during inspection.

comments.name: COMMENTS
comments.text: Smoke detectors are present and were not tested.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Faucet appears serviceable
Hand sprayer appears serviceable
Drain appears serviceable

comments.name: KITCHEN CABINETS/COUNTERTOPS
comments.text: Cabinets and counter tops appear serviceable

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the range/cook top and oven:
Unit is not level, recommend leveling.

comments.name: TYPE
comments.text: Recirculating type hood. Recommend regular cleaning of filters for proper operation.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text: Appears serviceable. A normal/quick/rinse wash cycle was run at the time of the inspection. No leaking noted. No other cycles were tested at the time of the inspection.

comments.name: WATER AND WASTE CONDITION
comments.text: No washing machine installed. Laundry plumbing was not tested. Inspector is not allowed to operate valves. We Highly recommend verifying proper operation of plumbing before close of transaction.

comments.name: ELECTRICAL AND GAS CONDITION
comments.text:
240V Service-operational and the electrical outlet is grounded
3 prong outlet provided.  Recommend upgrading to a 4 prong outlet if possible.

comments.name: DRYER VENTING CONDITION
comments.text:
Dryer venting is provided
The following concerns were noted at the dryer vent:
Dryer vent exhaust flapper is dirty/blocked. Recommend cleaning.

comments.name: DUCTS/AIR SUPPLY
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the ducts/air supply system:
Flex duct is resting on the attic floor. Monitor for sweating and condensation build-up and relocate as needed.
Gray vinyl covered ducts noted. Some manufacturers of these ducts have experienced product failure in residential use. Recommend monitoring for future problems.

comments.name: GENERAL CONDITION OF CONDENSER - COMPRESSOR
comments.text:
Appears operational
The following concerns were noted with the air conditioning condenser/compressor:
Coils are dirty. Recommend cleaning and servicing the system. Make any recommended repairs.
Missing/damaged insulation noted on refrigerant line in the attic. Recommend repair.

comments.name: EVAPORATOR CONDENSATE LINE AND/PAN
comments.text:
Condensate line installed.
Float switch noted/not tested
The following concerns were noted with overflow drain pan:
Damage/rusting noted at pan. Monitor for problems.

comments.name: RETURN AIR SHAFT
comments.text:
Appears serviceable but signs of wear and aging noted. Monitor for problems.
The following concerns were noted at the return air shaft:
Previous repairs noted. Verify reason with seller and monitor for on-going or future problems.

comments.name: GENERAL PEST COMMENTS
comments.text: According to the MLS, property is currently under a termite contract. Recommend ensuring transferability of contract and maintaining it throughout duration of occupancy.

Roof appears to be near the end of its life. Recommend evaluation by a qualified licensed roofer and repair/replace.
